page.title: 14Hospital Treatment
page.content: During the Easter holiday I was climbing a tree when I fell, landed badly on my elbow and felt terrific pain. Luckily my friend was with me and he found my dad who took me to Bangour Hospital. There I was x_rayed and my arm put in a sling as it was broken. There is no paediatrician at the hospital so it was necessary to travel 20 miles to Leith Hospital for treatment. An ambulance was phoned for and arrived half an hour later. During the journey I was given a whiff of gas to help the pain. After arriving at Leith Hospital I was put into bed and had to wait about three hours before being taken to the theatre where they put me to sleep. When I woke up my arm was in a sling and was giving me jipp. In all I had to wait for five painful hours to have my elbow set.
